online.common
Interface SpriteProtocol

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleSprite
public interface SpriteProtocol

The sprite protocol is a rudimentary mechanism for animating sprites across the board, with minimal interaction or effort to the game. A sample implementation is available as SimpleSprite. The general expectation is that sprites have a starting and ending time, and will draw themselves on request any time between the start and finish.

use addSprite to add a sprite to the active list

Author:
ddyer

Method Detail

draw

void draw(java.awt.Graphics gc,
          exCanvas c,
          long now)
draw is called last during drawing of the game redraw, to draw this sprite with the specified gc.

Parameters:
gc - the current gc for drawing
c - the canvas being drawn on
now - the current time, in milliseconds

isExpired

boolean isExpired(long now)
return true if this sprite has expired and should be deleted.

Parameters:
now - the current time in milliseconds
Returns:
true if the sprite has finished

isStarted

boolean isStarted(long now)
return true if this sprite has started moving

Parameters:
now -
Returns:
true if started

cancel

void cancel()
request this sprite to inactivate itself and return any resources.

isOverlapped

boolean isOverlapped()
return true if this animation is supposed to overlap cell contents. This is used to inhibit the normal behavior of turning off display of the destination cell until the animation finishes

Returns:
true if the destination should remain visible rather than being invisible until the animation finishes

isAlwaysActive

boolean isAlwaysActive()
Used when chaining several steps to the endpoint, where the endpoint is already placed.

Returns:
true if this animation is always active.

animationHeight

int animationHeight()
return the height of this animation element. This is used to reduce the height of the destination stack when animating a move. In most cases this will be "1", but when moving a stack as a single element, it's the height of the stack.
